name: Wildwood Manor Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drove up thru the woods (the entrance to their 11 acres) only to be met by the owners and some deer. What a fantastic place (clean, serene, and nice!!!). My wife and I were exploring the NW and the SanJuan Islands fell on our list and she found Wildwood on Trip Advisor. Michael makes superb breakfasts (even asks if you have any food allergies). He also makes great cookies and had Reese's peanut butter cups available. The rooms are perfect; beds great; views to "die for"; and a hammock outside that called to me (my wife saw the deer almost kissing me as I was asleep). If you had to model a B&B after anyplace.....this would be it. The sad thing is that John only spends one week a month there (works in San Francisco), which makes Michael having to run this by himself. I can't imagine him having more time on his hands. Also ask him where to eat and what to do....he gives good advice.
reviews.title: I'd buy it right now, if it was for sale...........

likes.disliked: — No internet unless you have your own laptop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 3 nights at this wonderful retreat for my boyfriend's 30th Birthday from 5/2-5/5 2008. The hospitality was more than I ever could have asked for, Michael and John made sure we had the best weekend possible. I took several of their recommendations ahead of time and enjoyed every single one. San Juan Island was a welcoming and relaxing place to visit, I will be back, hopefully to see whales next time.
reviews.title: Don't Miss out on this Wonderful Bed & Breakfast

likes.liked: — The owners, the view, the deer, the decor, the breakfasts and the cookies

reviews.text: The house was beautiful, immaculate, and extremely comfortable, with everything we needed. The breakfasts are amazing (5+ stars) and a great way to start your day, with the added touch of coffee ready at 7am every day. The homemade cookies and brownies that were out for our enjoyment anytime were the best I have ever tasted. Everything you ever wanted was always available - bottled water and soda in the refrigerator, crackers, amazing organic teas, hot chocolate, and the huge movie selection for a cozy few hours in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
Wildwood Manor a 10+
reviews.text: The grounds were also amazing with the resident deer and birds fun to watch and the view from our room (Decatur), the breakfast room, and the great room stunning.

Looking back I am still amazed at the attention to detail throughout the entire house as well as the gardens and just how friendly and welcoming Michael and John were. We only had a few days to get to know them, but I feel like we made friends for life.
reviews.title: The Utimate B & B Experience!

likes.liked: — Gracious hospitality in a beautiful setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to finish, our stay at Wildwood was wonderful. We would definitely stay here again. Michael and his staff are very good at everything they do, whether it be provide a luxurious room, bake cookies, make breakfast, or direct us to local activities and restaurants. The manor has a lovely setting with lots of birds and wildlife right outside the window.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful. We only had one night here, but it was lovely. We had the San Juan room, and to be honest, it was a bit pricy for me, but it was our anniversary, and we decided to splurge. I don't know that the San Juan room is worth the extra...($275 with tax per night) I think the other rooms are quite nice and would likely go with them in the future.
reviews.title: Gorgeous.
The best Bed & Breakfast around!
reviews.text: Michael is extremely warm, the decor is exquisite, and the setting is gorgeous. Deer greeted us at every corner of the house. I awoke to 5 blacktail bucks feeding just out the front door.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, and we did not want for anything. The cookies, the tea, the coffee...the view. All grand. Michael is also an excellent tour guide consultant.
reviews.title: First Class

likes.liked: — The hosts, the room and the food

reviews.title: "The Best" I give it 6 Stars!
reviews.text: My husband and I spent last night at what is probably the nicest Bed and Breakfast that we have ever stayed at. The manor and the grounds are beautiful, and the inkeeper, Michael, was the perfect host. We stayed in the Decatur room, which is on its own floor at the top of the house. The view of the ocean from our window was breathtaking, and the decor of the room, like the entire house, was incredibly tasteful. They provide menus from all of the restaurants that they recommend, which was very helpful to us since we arrived just before dinnertime and food was foremost on our minds. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. Breakfast was delicious. Our menu consisted of yogurt with strawberries, Hawaiian sweet bread french toast, ham and baked pears. Overall, our experience was wonderful and we can't wait to go back next year. This time we will stay longer than just one night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wildwood Manor is a dream for anyone who loves comfort, style and the best breakfasts you could possibly dream of.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth
Wildwood Manor,an Outstanding San Juan B & B
reviews.text: The Inn has been beautifully decorated, lots of rich wood touches, yet light and welcoming with distant views of the bay and mountains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are heavenly, the linens wonderful, bathrooms are wonderfully appointed with luxurious towels and toiletries.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: Freshly brewed coffee, fine teas as well as homemade cookies and fruit are available 24 hours.
reviews.title: The BEST Bed and Breakfast We have Ever Stayed In

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is amazing, you really need to visit to believe it! Michael posts a new breakfast menu everyday, chocked full of homemade creations. I could not wait until breakfast!
reviews.title: Ready to Go Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spend a weekend at Wildwood Manor and loved it. We had the most amazing experience! Nestled in the woods, with an amazing view of the Puget Sound and Vancouver, Canada – it was relaxing, calming and so quiet. And, the service was more than I ever could have expected.
reviews.title: Wildwood Manor is first class. Exceptional service, location and accommodations!

likes.liked: — Everything! I really wouldn't change anything. From the service, food, location - it was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, we were greeted at the door by one of the owners. The B&B is immaculate! Not only is it spotless and sparkling, but it’s cozy and has all the amenities of home (including homemade cookies, soda, snacks, candy, tea, etc.). In addition, there is a huge library of books, DVD’s and menus of local restaurants. The freshly baked cookies always available were my personal favorite.
reviews.title: Amazing retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was just perfect. We had two windows in the room, both with views of the water. Walking into our bedroom, we found a welcome note and chocolates. Num! Everything in the room was comfortable, warm and had what we needed. There were robes in the closet, a flat screen TV, a great writing desk looking over the water, a jewelry holder next to the bed, local art from the island – no detail left unnoticed. The bathroom was great – with beautiful tile work, luscious towels and plenty of storage space.
reviews.title: Extraordinary B&B experience

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I didn't like. It was wonderful all around.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning, we woke up to the smell of the most amazing breakfast. We were served a three-course meal. A perfect way to start the day! It was filling, absolutely delicious and there was enough for seconds! We ate in the dining room, again with gorgeous view of the water, and deer! I’ve never seen so many deer up close before. The first morning, I think we counted 11. Fabulous!
reviews.title: Great atmosphere and wonderful food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anytime we had questions about what to do or where to go – we received the best recommendations. It was like having our own, personal concierge service! They even made reservations for us.
reviews.title: The Best Place On Earth

likes.liked: — The thoughtfulness of John, Michael and family

aka: Wildwood Manor Bed And Breakfast Friday Harbor, San Juan Island, WA
description: Located on a knoll with sweeping views of the water and woods, Wildwood Manor is the perfect setting for you to relax, restore and renew yourself. Enjoy casual elegance beneath the Douglas firs, while exploring the beauty of San Juan Island. Our Queen Anne-style home features three water view and wood side view guestrooms and two romantic water view suites, all with private baths and luxurious amenities. Enjoy our beautiful landscape and wooded walking paths, or simply watch the sailboats on San Juan Channel from our deck.
